dialog.text: Ella, we just recieved a request for help at the Georgia Aquarium. The majority of the fish in the salt water aquarium are gathering towards the surface of the water. Grab your gear and meet Mr. Yoshi at the saltwater exibit.
Hi, you must be Mr. Yoshi. I'm Ella from the Elite Detective Squad.
Thank you for getting here so quickly. I noticed last night that the fish are gathering at the surface of the water.

Chica, I believe that the fish are swimming slowly and floating toward the surface because thay lack energy and are looking for oxygen. The torn and jagged fins are the physical result of poor tank conditions. I believe testing is needed. What do you think?
I agree. Those are signs of oxygen deprivation. We need to find out what is causing it.

If it is an oxygen problem, then I need to make sure. There are more fish in the tank than there is supposed to be. Also, I need to make sure the water temperature is accurate. A higher water temperature would require higher levels of oxygen.

That is correct Ella. That exhibit has only tropical fish, so the temperature should be between 75-77 degrees F. The current capacity for the tank is 1-inch for every 5 gallons. That exhibit has a 400 gallon tank and 200 one inch fish, 75 two inch fish and 30 four inch fish. One more thing to check is the PH level of the water. For a salt water tank, it should between 7.6-8.4.

clues.text: The majority of the fish seem to be floating or swimming slowly.
clues.question: Why would fish float instead of swim?

answers.text: The fish lack energy.
It is normal for the majority of the fish to display these characteristics.
The fish were overfed and have to wait until the food digests to swim normally again.

clues.hint: Fish are similar to humans in this instance and tend to slow down for the same reason.

clues.text: The majority of the fish are near the surface of the water, some with their mouths open.
clues.question: What causes saltwater fish to float near the surface of the water?

answers.text: The fish are cold and float closer to the surface for the warmth of the sun.
The fish are hungry and are waiting for food.
The fish are looking for oxygen.

clues.hint: The fact that their mouths are open indicates that they are gasping for something.

clues.text: There majority of the fish are brightly colored.
clues.question: Why are the majority of the fish brightly colored?

answers.text: The bright colors allow the fish to blend in with their environment.
The colors of the fish intensify when they are kept in captivity.
The fish aren't brightly colored, it is an illusion caused by the reflection of the tank light.

clues.hint: This is used to protect the fish from predators.

clues.text: Many of the fish have torn or jagged fins.
clues.question: Why would the fish have jagged or torn fins?

answers.text: These are the male fish that have battled with the other males to establish dominance.
Ammonia levels of the tank are above 1-2 ppm.
The fish were born with this abnormality.

clues.hint: The environment affects the physical attributes of the fish.

testing.concern: Temperature of tank is warmer than 75-77 degrees F
testing.testText: Take the temperature of the tank water

testing.concern: The water's PH is not between 7.6-8.4
The water's PH is not between 7.6-8.4
testing.testText: Analyze 400 gallon tank 200 1 inch fish 75 two inch fish 30 four inch fish.

test.question: What is the temperature of the water??
What is the PH of the water?
The current capacity of the tank is?

answers.text: Under Stocked
Over Stocked
Correctly Stocked
